repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: The Kantapurāṇam is one of the major Tamil texts about the god Skanda/Murukaṉ. It is the work of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār (14th century?).
The text is complete. The table of contents (U4, f[1]v, c4, 12–13) gives a total of 155 paṭalams and 10303 stanzas.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, title-page, invocation page, addendum, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statement, colophon.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page. No foliation. Verso blank.
1 folio = Kantapurāṇam: Invocation. No foliation. Addendum (blessings), unblackened, by a later hand on verso.
391 folios = Kantapurāṇam: Mūlam. Tamil foliation [1]‒391. 8 to 10 lines per page.
1 folio = Table of Contents. No foliation.

supportDesc.condition: Very bad state of preservation. Leaves are brittle, due to age and numerous bore holes caused by insects. Edges are often truncated.

origin.origDate: See colophon (U3, f[391]v3). Dated to 1713 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds.

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine (1912). Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 48.
Rosny, Léon de (1868). La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.

encodingDesc.p: Transliteration conventions ― Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). ― Abbreviations ― c = column, f = folio, lf = library foliation = lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.
